Header: Don’t try our patience, North Korea tells U.S. a year after accord
Content: North Korea warned the United States that agreements made between the two countries’ leaders in Singapore last year could be at risk, blaming the United States for undue pressure to denuclearise. Nearly a year after U.S. President Donald Trump and North Korean leader Kim Jong Un first met and signed a joint statement pledging to work towards a new relationship, that agreement could be at risk if the United States does not drop its policy of “only insisting on our unilateral surrender of nuclear weapons”, according to foreign ministry statement carried by the North’s state-run television KRT.
